Docs.summary: Exposes types to [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)].

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.ContentElement owner) cil managed

Docs.param: The that is associated with this .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer CreatePeerForElement(class System.Windows.ContentElement element) cil managed

Docs.param: The that is associated with this .
Docs.summary: Creates a for the specified .
Docs.returns: The for the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer> remains in memory until the associated <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement> is destroyed.
The same instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer> is returned from subsequent calls to this method and to calls to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer.FromElement%2A>. The type of the peer is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnCreateAutomationPeer%2A> virtual callback. If <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement> does not implement the callback, no <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer> is created and this method returns `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets the for the specified .
Docs.returns: The for the specified , or if the has not been created by the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer.CreatePeerForElement%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetAutomationIdCore() cil managed

Docs.returns: A string containing the automation identifier.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of the automation identifier is the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property, and if that isn't set, it's the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Rect GetBoundingRectangleCore() cil managed

Docs.returns: The collection of child elements.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetClassNameCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the that is associated with this . Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName%2A>.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.String> string.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Point GetClickablePointCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a that represents the clickable space that is on the that is associated with this . Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint%2A>.
Docs.returns: The point that represents the clickable space that is on the element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, if the element is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>, the clickable point is any point that is within the visible client area of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> that would result in issuing the command that the button represents, when the user clicks the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> by using the mouse.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetHelpTextCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the string that describes the functionality of the that is associated with this . Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHelpText%2A>.
Docs.returns: The string that describes the functionality of the that is associated with this .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The string that is returned generally is the same text that is provided in the tooltip for the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetItemStatusCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a string that conveys the visual status of the that is associated with this . Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemStatus%2A>.
Docs.returns: A string containing the status.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, the status of a messenger contact could be "Busy" or "Online".

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetItemTypeCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a human-readable string that contains the type of the item that the that is associated with this represents. Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemType%2A>.
Docs.returns: The string that contains the item type.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer GetLabeledByCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the for the that is targeted to the that is associated with this . Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy%2A>.
Docs.returns: The for the element that is targeted by the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, if the element is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> control, the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy%2A> method could get the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> that is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetNameCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the text label of the that is associated with this . Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName%2A>.
Docs.returns: The string that contains the label.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The name property can be thought of as the string of text that a user would use to explain which control is being referred to. It is important to have a textual representation for all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.

Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsEnabledCore() cil managed

Docs.returns: if the automation peer can receive and send events; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsKeyboardFocusableCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the that is associated with this can accept keyboard focus. Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsOffscreenCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether that is associated with this is off of the screen. Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen%2A>.
Docs.returns: if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property does not indicate whether the element is visible. In some circumstances, an element can be on the screen but still not be visible, for example if the element is obscured by other elements. In this case the method would return `false`.
